<RESUME_START>
DIRECTOR OF INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY

SUMMARY

IT Director/Manager with extensive experience in network operations, leveraging expertise in organization growth and problem solving.
Driven, professional and detailed-oriented with the proven ability to plan, design and implement technical systems, improve process flow and administer departmental budgets.
Highlights
Operating Systems: Windows 7, 8.1, 10, Windows Server 2008 R2 & 2012 Exchange Server 2007 & 2010 - Apple; Mac OSX & iOS - BB10 OS, Android LAN, VPN, WAN IP networking Citrix and remote terminal services, LogMeIn, Team Viewer, Skype for business.
Experience with SQL, SaaS and Hyper-V Active Directory Services, Group Policy, DNS, DHCP, SSL, WSUS and FTP San/Nas Storage, Cisco Routers, HP Switches, Sonicwall Firewalls Symantec Backup/AntiVirus, Trend — Micro , Arcserve, Acronis

EXPERIENCE

January 1996
to
January 2016
Company Name
City ,
State
Director of Information Technology
Directed and managed the entire IT operations for a commercial real estate investment company with over 15 locations throughout the U.S.
Forecasted and planned all network information processing and communication needs for the entire company.
Provided senior level leadership on all IT security and risk management concerns.
Being proactive to ensure the continued functionality of a stable, reliable, and secure IT environment, including focus on current and anticipated cybersecurity threats and risk.
Ensured technology compliance with SOX, PCI, IT general and regulatory controls.
Established, documented and administered all IT operational policies and procedures to control systems and integrity risks.
Created and analyzed annual IT operational and capital budgets and 5-year plans.
Efficiently used monies allocated within those budgets.
Inspected 3rd party contracts, evaluated and negotiated proposals for software and hardware services.
Project leader for developing, planning and instituting disaster recovery and business continuity.
Provided redundancy on all network components and system failovers.
Redundant communication and internet lines using BGP for failover.
Ensured the consistency of existing applications by creating, maintaining, testing and enforcing standards/procedures for implementing software rollouts.
Used document imaging system for record retention.
Maintained and upgraded all Audio/Video in conference rooms.
Installed office security: Card key and camera systems.
Hired and managed system administrators and supervised outside consultants.
Originally hired as IT Manager promoted to Director in 2002.

Provided network administration, PC and network trouble shooting, file server configuration, backup systems configuration, network and switch management.
Maintained Lotus Notes Domino Mail Server, operating system and application software upgrading, anti-virus and firewall management, hardware configuration and troubleshooting, application maintenance and administration.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Manager, Engineering

Location: Austin, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Position Summary

As an Engineering Manager at Wheel, you’ll be responsible for building software and running teams that are critical to the success of the company. You will lay the foundation for our engineering team, focused on creating technology platforms and products to support our mission to become the infrastructure of Virtual Care. In this position, you will work across the entire company, and closely with clients to define and deliver your goals. The majority of your work would be ‘green field’ with the opportunity to be part of defining best-in-class solutions to virtual care problems. You are a true people leader; someone who believes in “we” before “me” and your team’s motivation, growth, and wellbeing first. You are self-motivated, versatile, and compassionate, and can work equally well in highly collaborative settings as well as those with little direction.

This position is open for candidates in the following locations:

Austin, Texas

Boston, Massachusetts

Chicago, Illinois

New York City, New York

San Francisco Bay Area, California

Seattle, Washington

Responsibilities

Support, mentor and grow your engineers to help them continuously improveEnsure we’re constantly moving our product forward in a build-learn-iterate modelMentor and guide your team in best-practices for modern web products and distributed systemsBe ‘hands on’ - you can still code alongside your teamCollaborate with product, design, and leadership to ideate and develop winning products that help move the business forwardDesign, build, deploy and maintain systems and user experiences that scale with a high growth companyTake ownership of new features, big and small, analyzing system and business metrics post-release

Technologies We Use And Teach

Node/TypeScriptRubyReact and VuePostgreSQLAWSDocker and KubernetesKafka

Qualifications

3+ years of management experience, running multiple teams simultaneouslyAptitude for working in a collaborative environment as an empathetic teammate6+ years of experience with full-stack development, building real-world web applications in production environmentsYou can operate autonomously and have a strong desire to make an impactExemplary communication skills; able to explain possible solutions to non-technical team membersBonus points if you have prior startup experience or have experience building highly scalable products. Growth startup experience - series A/B is idealProven ability to learn new technologies quicklyThrives in a collaborative and diverse environment

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
